summary: This bill, the Health Equity and Rare Disease Act of 2025 (HEARD Act of 2025), aims to increase research, awareness, and access to care for rare diseases, particularly those disproportionately affecting minority populations. It mandates NIH to expand, intensify, and coordinate research, establishes a coordinating committee, and requires a comprehensive plan to address these diseases. The bill includes grant programs for data collection, physician training, mentoring, and scholarships/loan repayment. It also calls for reports on federal efforts, clinical trial diversity, FDA actions, and Medicare barriers. Finally, it addresses activities in Native American/Tribal communities and expands research and awareness campaigns as well as FDA report.
